abstract: A J.P. Morgan Chase executive may find himself working for the former boss of a rival investment bank, Goldman Sachs, as the Bush administration continues to cull appointees from the top Wall Street banks. Reuters reported that the administration is considering T. Timothy Ryan, a former top financial regulator who is vice chairman for financial institutions and governments at J.P. Morgan, to become Treasury’s point person on international affairs.
lead_paragraph: A J.P. Morgan Chase executive may find himself working for the former boss of a rival investment bank, Goldman Sachs, as the Bush administration continues to cull appointees from the top Wall Street banks. Reuters reported that the administration is considering T. Timothy Ryan, a former top financial regulator who is vice chairman for financial institutions and governments at J.P. Morgan, to become Treasury’s point person on international affairs.

headline.main: J.P. Morgan Executive Eyed for Treasury Post, Report Says
